question.name: q1
question.text: Rate the overall performance of this resident.

option.description: Not at PGY-1

question.name: q2
question.text: Patient Care: Selection and preparation of patients for regional anesthesia (RA).

option.description: Not at PGY-1

Reviews pt records thoroughly and chooses suitable candidates for RA by screening for neurologic, cardiovascular, respiratory, infectious, coagulopathic , analgesic, behavioral or other concerns; Confirms surgical procedure; Chooses suitable block based on anticipated site of surgery or desired zone of analgesic coverage; Completes comprehensive informed consent with patient including risks, benefits, levels and laterality; Presents pertinent summary to RAAPS attending before block

Chooses appropriate block needle and local anesthetic depending on the desired duration and surgical site; Site marks pt for regional block; Assures proper IV access and monitoring; Positions pt for correct level(s) or laterality, needle access and comfort during RA; Performs pre-procedural time-out with nurse; Administers appropriate sedation with indirect supervision; Performs aseptic technique, incl. hand cleansing. Requests direct supervision from RAAPS attending for complex patients.
Manages peri-procedural care in complex patients or situations with indirect supervision and efficiency; Demonstrates efficiency in duties above. Assures presence of RAAPS attending as needed
Manages peri-procedural care for all patients, including those with chronic pain, hyperalgesia, and medical, physical or behavioral limitations with conditional independence
Independently manages peri-procedural care of all patients getting RA

question.name: q3
question.text: Patient Care: Response to emergencies on RAAPS service (e.g. severe uncontrolled pain; acute cardiovascular, respiratory or neurologic events; LA toxicity; epidural hematoma/abscess; falls; serious side effects of medications, etc.)

option.description: Not at PGY-1

Recognizes problems or complications associated with regional anesthesia, and manages them with direct supervision; Initiates basic medical care for common urgencies events such as acute pain and epidural induced hypotension; Seeks help appropriately; Knows where resuscitative equipment and emergency medications are located

Constructs prioritized differential diagnoses that include the most likely etiologies for acute clinical deterioration from a regional technique or medication; Initiates treatment quickly at bedside with indirect supervision and seeks direct supervision appropriately.

Identifies and manages clinical crises with indirect supervision; monitors pts closely during and after interventions; Communicates promptly with relevant health care providers; engages RAAPS attending for complex patients
Identifies and manages clinical crises appropriately with conditional independence; assumes increasing responsibility for leadership of crisis response team
Coordinates crisis team response

question.name: q4
question.text: Patient Care: Performance and follow-up of acute pain consults on RAAPS.

option.description: Not at PGY-1

Performs thorough pain history including review of previous surgery or injury, prior and current effective or ineffective medication use or interventions, substance abuse or addiction, and medical, physical and behavioral limitations. Performs targeted physical exam. Elicits baseline pain score and function. Initiates non-interventional, routine therapy for common pain problems with indirect supervision

Under direct supervision of RAAPS attending, formulates analgesic plan to include opioid and non-opioid medications, regional anesthesia, and non-pharmacologic interventions; Confers with other health care providers as needed for complex pts; Completes prompt and comprehensive consult note; Shares recommendations with primary team directly; Evaluates efficacy of current medication regimen

Formulates and implements comprehensive, multimodal analgesic plan in complex pts, including those with acute-on-chronic pain and opioid tolerance, with indirect supervision of RAAPS attending. Adjusts medications for evolving pain needs; Rounds on pts multiple times daily as required for safety and comfort; Presents pts to RAAPS team in organized, concise and pertinent manner; Implements assessment techniques for opioid tolerant or addicted pts.
Advises junior residents on management of consults with conditional independence; Confers with chronic pain specialists, psychiatrists, and pharmacists for complex pts.

Participates in coordination of care for patients with complex pain problems; Serves as a consultant to other members of the health care team regarding initial evaluation and management of the patient with acute, chronic, or cancer-related pain

question.name: q5
question.text: Patient Care: Use and Interpretation of Monitoring and Equipment during performance of regional anesthesia (RA).

option.description: Not at PGY-1

Demonstrates the correct use of standard monitoring devices, including blood pressure (BP) cuff, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulse oximeter; Interprets data from standard monitoring devices, including recognition of artifacts; Prepares and correctly labels local anesthetic syringes with appropriate dose of adjuvants

Assures placement and correct interpretation of pulse ox, NIBP, EKG; Places IV’s successfully; Selects, prepares and organizes correct equipment for blocks; Administers appropriate pre-procedural sedation; Understands basic principles of ultrasound (US) and peripheral nerve stimulation (PNS); Vigilantly notes, interprets and responds to changes in vital signs during block placement

Optimizes settings for ultrasound and peripheral nerve stimulator; Properly secures and labels indwelling catheters; Assesses regional blocks independently after placement and supplements as needed. Monitors and documents vitals after epidural boluses and responds w appropriate intervention; Independently assesses, redresses and removes indwelling catheters, (timed, if applicable, w relevant lab data)

Obtains vascular access in complex or difficult situations; Supervises other members of the health care team in preparation of monitors and equipment for placement of basic blocks. Recognizes equipment malfunctions and troubleshoots appropriately.
Independently selects and uses all basic and advanced monitoring and equipment. Performs all procedures without supervision.

question.name: q6
question.text: Patient Care: Technical skills in regional anesthesia.

option.description: Not at PGY-1

Performs hand washing and proper sterile technique; Attempts simple regional anesthetics under direct supervision. Identifies physiologic changes associated with local anesthesia administration and seeks help appropriately

Properly identifies surface landmarks and recognizes most relevant structures on US; Demonstrates proper probe alignment and needling techniques; Adjusts needle advancement based on US image, spread of LA, and injection pressure; Correctly interprets paresthesias or twitches from peripheral nerve stimulation (PNS); Demonstrates proficiency with lumbar epidurals and single shot peripheral nerve blocks with increasing success under direct supervision.
Usually succeeds at placing thoracic epidurals and perineural catheters under direct supervision; Demonstrates good hand eye coordination and efficiency in completing blocks.

Performs neuraxial and peripheral nerve blocks with conditional independence in complex patients such as those with hyperalgesia, morbid obesity, limited mobility, or mental disability; Supervises junior residents performing regional anesthetics.
Independently performs peripheral and neuraxial regional anesthesia techniques Independently manages problems or complications associated with regional anesthesia.

question.name: q7
question.text: Medical Knowledge: Knowledge of biomedical, clinical, epidemiological, and social-behavioral sciences as outlined in the American Board of Anesthesiology Content Outline (incl. RAAPS).

option.description: Not at PGY-1

Demonstrates knowledge of the etiology, pathophysiology, diagnosis, and treatment of common medical and surgical problems; Has passed Steps 1 and 2 of the United States Medical Licensing Examination (USMLE) or the Comprehensive Osteopathic Medical Licensing Examination (COMLEX).

Achieves satisfactory Medical Knowledge rating by the Clinical Competence Committee (CCC) related to the anesthetic care of healthy patients undergoing routine procedures Achieves a program-defined score on the American Board of Anesthesiology (ABA) In-Training Examination or equivalent examination; Has passed all steps of USMLE or COMLEX; Demonstrates basic knowledge of the dermatomal and nerve supply of the body, duration of action and toxicity of local anesthetics, and impact of coagulation on regional blocks

Achieves satisfactory Medical Knowledge rating by the CCC related to the anesthetic care of subspecialty or medically-complex patients; Achieves a program-defined score on the ABA In-Training Examination or equivalent examination Passes the ABA Basic Examination; Displays in depth knowledge of the anatomy and function of specific nerves; Displays in depth knowledge of the pathophysiology of acute and chronic pain

Achieves satisfactory Medical Knowledge rating by the CCC related to anesthetic care of all patients; Achieves a program-defined score on the ABA In-Training Examination or equivalent examination; Applies knowledge appropriately to patient management; Practices evidence based medicine
Passes the ABA Advanced and Applied Examinations and enrolls in Maintenance of Certification in Anesthesiology (MOCA)
